events.name: International Womens Day - Kisumu 2017

venue.name: LakeHub
venue.address_1: Innovation Ln, off, Achieng' Oneko Rd, Kisumu, Kenya

events.description:
We believe women are an essential part of the tech community. We have set aside this day to mentor and bring together women. Be a part of us on this day

Might excite you
We will be having girls from primary and secondary schools from Kisumu present the mobile applications they have built since the year begun

events.name: Google I/O Extended Kisumu 2017
events.description: I/O Extended events include a variety of options for both aspiring and experienced developers—from live streaming sessions to local demos, hackathons, codelabs, and more. Come catch up with us on the latest technologies this year!

events.name: DEVFEST WESTERN KENYA 2017
events.description:
GDG DevFests are large, community-run events that can offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, all-day hack-a-thons, code labs, and more.

After three very successful devfest and one major successful devfest Western Kenya 2015

GDG Kisumu, MMUST, Kisii and Rongo are once again happy to announce the third annual GDG DevFest 2017 ­the largest Google related event in Kisumu.

This year we are doing it bigger and better by partnering with four GDGs(GDG Kisumu,Kisii,Rongo and MMUST)

Overall objective of the event:

Android: new features in Nougat, tools, best practices, frameworks & libraries for building native mobile apps. Kotlin, RxJava, Data Binding, testing, architecture best practices.

Web: Web frameworks, AngularJS, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, best practices, libraries & tools to build web apps, Polymer, RAIL, Node Js, React JS

Cloud & BigData: Firebase, Kubernetes, Docker, Cloud, PaaS, TensorFlow, Vision API, Speech API, best practices, NoSQL, Spark, Hadoop, Drill, Machine learning

IoT: raspberry Pi, Arduino , Picaxe, Low energy Bluetooth Beacons,Smart Devices

AGENDA COMING UP

events.name: Lets understand Rails and how its related to ruby and the web
events.description:
• What we'll do
Gear up for an exciting hour covering
- Ruby on Rails
- The relation between Model, view, and controller.
- How Ruby on Rails maps into software as a service architecture
- How rails use the active model concept to achieve database persistence

• What to bring

• Important to know
We are doing this together with the ruby kisumu team https://www.meetup.com/Ruby-Kisumu

events.name: GDG Kisumu, I/O Extended – Google I/O 2018

venue.name: LakeHub
venue.address_1: Innovation Ln, off, Achieng' Oneko Rd, Kisumu, Kenya

events.description:
I/O brings together developers from around the globe annually for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

I/O Extended events include a variety of options for developers—from live streaming sessions to local demos, hackathons, codelabs, and more.
events.how_to_find_us: 40100, Rudolph Street, off Lolwe Drive. Next to the old PCs office

events.name: Cashakathon - real application of mpesa payment on websites
events.description:
We will be working on Safaricom's MPESA integration.
RUBY nerds, we will look at how to make a ruby gem using the mpesa STK and deploy it.
PYTHON nerds we will also be looking at how to do the integration using flask in python

events.name: Learn to program (girls get geeky ~ Kisumu)
events.description:
Girls Get Geeky is a Tech workshop for Aspiring ladies within the Tech field. The Kisumu Edition is the first and the biggest of the Girls Get Geeky Workshops in Kenya. We invite, but not limited to, all tech girls or ladies to attend. It's gonna be lit since there's a lot to learn, too much fun, Prices & swags and above all... FOOOOD!

What you need:

Kindly carry with you a laptop, if you own one, a notebook and a pen(If you wanna).

Sign up and RSVP for the event early enough due to limitations in seat slots.

We look foward to seeing you there.

events.name: Devfest Western Kenya
events.description:
Welcome to Devfest Western Kenya Edition.
DevFests are community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies.
DevFest events cover multiple product areas such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning with TensorFlow, and Mobile Web

events.name: Flutter Study Jam -Kisumu
events.description:
Join us as we teach you how to get started with flutter for building mobile applications.

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source
events.how_to_find_us:
We are opposite Lions High School,  besides mega city mall on the road leading to Moi Stadium. 
We are inside the Lutheran church compound

events.name: IWD Kisumu 2019 Hackathon

venue.name: LakeHub
venue.address_1: Innovation Ln, off, Achieng' Oneko Rd, Kisumu, Kenya

events.description:
Women TechMakers Kisumu is organizing the International Women's Day Technology Hackathon 2019. We look forward to growing and moulding more lady techies and make a difference in tech events around here. Multiple sets of activities will be put in order for the 24 hour Hackathon that is set to Kickstart on the morning of 13th April at exactly 10:00 a.m and end on Sunday the 14th of April 2019.

The Hackathon Project will be communicated on the day of the event for the sake of fairness to all teams. Swags and Prices are up for the winning team. So assemble your team and sign up to secure a spot early enough. Note that all team members need to RSVP and if you don't already have a team there's always room for more formations at the IWD'19 Hackathon. Keep your Tickets safe.

On Sunday 14th April. All teams will pitch their creative projects to the panel. Make sure you dress warm for the night.

For More information kindly reach out to: [masked]

events.name: I/O EXTENDED  2019,KISUMU
events.description: I/O Extended events include a variety of options for both aspiring and experienced developers—from live streaming sessions to local demos, hackathons, codelabs, and more. Sign up for a chance to take part in this tech revolution.

events.name: KOTLIN/ EVERYWHERE KISUMU
events.description: In continuation for the Kotlin Codelabs that we started on during the IO Extended Kisumu, GDG Kisumu brings to you Kotlin Everywhere with the aim to equip all with knowledge, tools and networks as we learn Kotlin together.Do not forget to RSVP for this weekly meetup.See you then.

events.name: Localhost
events.description: MLH Localhost is an event of the hacker community, that people learn the skills that they're not getting in class or acquire new skill set, and have fun hackers with other hackers. We will be generally discussing effective programming skills and tools e.g git, agile method and TDD

upcoming.name: DevFestWestern Kenya 2019
upcoming.description:
This year we are going to tell you great stories and experiences of those in the technology field. Experience from those who did their computer science degree, those without any computing degree, those who never finished university to pursue their dreams, those who work for corporations, those who have startups.

That's not all, we are going to have technical sessions too:

Robotics: Come learn how to create robotic arms an approach from both the software and hardware and how collaboration helped create the remote controlled robotic arm

Ethical Hacking: Demonstrations of how different attacks and exploits are carried out, and how much data an attacker can acquire.

Web: using angular as a use case come and get to know one or two techniques of monitoring and increasing the performance of their applications.

Mobile: This session will be about how best one can use Firebase as a back end solution for your mobile application

Artificial Intelligence: Many people want to understand what AI is, and how they can start developing around it. We also need to champion the establishment of domain focused communities in the Western region in order to grow the tech and entrepreneurial ecosystem in Western Kenya

Mobile and web interface: GraphQL is a great interface for use in API, from a core maintainer of the graph-ql flutter package come learn how to interface your Flutter application using GraphQL

upcoming.name: Flutter Interact Viewing Party
upcoming.description: Flutter Interact is a day dedicated to creation and collaboration with the world, inspired by the makers of brilliant experiences. We will be hosting a viewing party in Kisumu on 14th December 2019. Feel fluttered.
upcoming.how_to_find_us: For any enquiries reach out to gettyorawo@gmail.com or call +254711903303.
